page.title: 15Pitreavie Castle (1)
page.content: The land on Which Pitreavie Castle stands, which is in squares eight and twelve, did not pass into the hands of the government until ninetten thirty eight. It cost the air ministry 12,306 pounds. Ever since NATO was formed in 1948,Pitreavie has been the home of the Joint Maritime Headquarters in the north. There is only one other base like this in the whole of the U.K., and it is therefore quite important. There is quite a lot of houses to accomodate the R.A.F. personel and their families. The recreation facilities are quite good, including a NAAFI Officer's Club, a gym, squash courts, tennis courts and a fottball pitch. Paul Steele
